hadithEnglish: Umar bin 'Ubaidullah bin Ma'mar intended to marry his son Talha with the daughter of Shaiba bin Jubair during the Pilgrimage. Aban bin Uthman was at that time the Amir of Pilgrims. So he ('Umar bin Ubaidullah) sent someone (as a messenger) to Aban saying: I intend to marry Talha bin 'Umar and I earnestly desire you to be present there (in this ceremony of marriage). Aban said to him: I find you a block-headed 'Iraqi. I heard 'Uthman bin 'Affan رضی اللہ عنہ say that Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) said: A Muhrim should not marry.

englishNarrator: Ibn Abbas ( رضی اللہ عنہ) reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) married Maimuna رضی اللہ عنہا in the state of Ihram. Ibn Numair made this addition: I narrated it to Zuhri and he said: Yazid bin al-Asamm (Allah be pleased with him) told me that he (the Holy Prophet ﷺ) married her when he was not a muhrim.
Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) married Maimuna while he was a Muhrim.

Maimuna daughter of al-Harith رضی اللہ عنہا narrated to me that Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) married her and he was not in the state of Ihram. And she (Maimuna) was my mother's sister and that of Ibn 'Abbas (رضی اللہ عنہ).

Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) as having said this: None amongst you should outbid another in a transaction, nor should he make proposals of marriage upon the proposal made by someone else.

englishNarrator: Ibn Umar ( رضی اللہ عنہ) reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) as having said this: A person should not enter into a transaction when his brother (had already entered into but not finalized), and he should not make proposal of marriage upon the proposal already made by his brother, until he permits it.
It was narrated from Ubaidullah with this chain (a hadith similar to no. 3455).
It was narrated from Nafi with this chain (a hadith similar to no. 3455).

englishNarrator: Abu Huraira ( رضی اللہ عنہ) reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Apostle ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) as having forbidden a dweller of the town selling the merchandise of a villager or outbidding in a sale (in order that another might fall into a snare), or a person making the proposal of marriage when his brother has already made such a proposal, or entering into a transaction when his brother has already entered; and a woman asking the divorce of her sister in order to deprive her of what belongs to her. 'Amr made this addition: The person should not purchase in opposition to his brother.

Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) as having said this: Do not outbid in a sale in order to ensnare. No man should enter into a transaction in which his brother has already entered, and no dweller of the town should sell on behalf of the villager. And no man should make a proposal of marriage which his brother has already made and no woman should ask for the divorce of another (co-wife) in order to deprive her of what belongs to her.

englishNarrator: A similar report (as no. 3460) was narrated from Az-Zuhri with this chain, except that in the Hadith of Mamar it says:
hadithEnglish: "And no man should outbid his brother.

Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) as saying: The Muslim should not purchase in opposition to his brother, and he should not make the proposal of marriage on the proposal already made by his brother.
It was narrated from Abu Huraira ( رضی اللہ عنہ) prophet ﷺ (a Hadith similar to no.3460).

englishNarrator: It was narrated from Shubah and others from Abu Hurairah رضی اللہ عنہ from the prophet ﷺ (a hadith similar to no. 3461) except that they said:
hadithEnglish: "...offer a higher price than his brother, or propose marriage when his brother has already propose.

englishNarrator: Uqba bin 'Amir رضی اللہ عنہ said on the pulpit:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ) said: A believer is the brother of a believer, so it is not lawful for a believer to outbid his brother, and he should not propose an engagement when his brother has thus proposed until he gives it up.

Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) prohibited Shighar which means that a man gives his daughter in marriage on the condition that the other gives his daughter to him in marriage without any dower being paid by either.
A hadith like this has been narrated on the authority of Abdullah bin 'Umar (رضی اللہ عنہ) but with a slight variation of words.
Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) prohibited Shighar.
Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) as having said: There is no Shighar in islam.

Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) prohibited Shighar. Ibn Numair added: Shighar means that a person should say to the other person: Give me the hand of your daughter in marriage and I will (in return) marry my daughter to you; or merry me your sister, and I will marry my sister to you.
This hadith has been narrated on the authority of Ibn Umar with the same chain of transmitters, but there is no mention of Ibn Numair.

englishNarrator: Jabir bin Abdullah (رضی اللہ عنہ) reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) prohibited Shighar.

englishNarrator: Uqba bin Amir (رضی اللہ عنہ) reported:
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ) as saying: The most worthy condition which must be fulfilled is that which makes sexual intercourse lawful. In the narration transmitted by Ibn Muthanna (instead of the word condition ) it is conditions .

Allah's Messenger ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌) as having said: A woman without a husband (or divorced or a widow) must not be married until she is consulted, and a virgin must not be married until her permission is sought. They asked the Prophet of Allah ( ‌صلی ‌اللہ ‌علیہ ‌وسلم ‌ ): How her (virgin's) consent can be solicited? He (the Holy Prophet) said: That she keeps silence.
A hadith similar to that of Hisham (no. 3473) with its chain was narrated from Ibn Abi Kathir. The wording of the Ahadith of Hisham, Shaiban and Muwiyah bin Salam are all the same.
